thread.section_title: ACLU of Northern California - Technology and Civil Liberties
thread.title: Act Now: Protect Digital Privacy with CalECPA
thread.title_full: Act Now: Protect Digital Privacy with CalECPA

author: Catrina Roallos
title: Act Now: Protect Digital Privacy with CalECPA
text:
| print 
The files in your desk are protected from warrantless searches. Your email, text messages, and other digital information should be properly protected too. California's digital privacy   last century, and it's time to catch up by passing   Communications Privacy Act (CalECPA). Take action » 
CalECPA would make sure that law enforcement and government agencies go to a judge and get a warrant before getting access to private digital information about who we are, where we go, who we know and what we do. CalECPA also includes appropriate exceptions to ensure that the police can continue to effectively and efficiently protect public safety. CalECPA is the right policy. 
CalECPA has already passed the California Senate and Assembly with broad bipartisan support. Now it’s time for the Gov. Jerry Brown to safeguard our digital information. Use this form to urge your Gov. Brown sign CalECPA (SB 178) into law.
